context: When coordinating GPT-5 reasoning across repos
lesson: Model archetypes defined in both frontend (dashboard selector) and backend (config manifest) must stay aligned. API emits reasoning via SSE, frontend consumes for admin-only visibility. Customer UX never exposes raw reasoning. Tight coupling prevents UX/API mismatch.

context: When mirroring dev tooling across repos
lesson: Both frontend and backend host internal docs at localhost:4173 with auto-enrichment from commits. Command bar shortcuts access both changelogs. Symmetric testing infrastructure: advisory Jest frontend, agent tools backend. Creates unified developer experience.

context: When IX Coach optimizes for multiple KPIs
lesson: KPIs tracked: conversion rate (SEO landing pages), coaching quality (GPT-5 reasoning), operational velocity (advisory tests, internal docs), SEO visibility (structured data), analytics accuracy (bot gating), enterprise readiness (SOC 2). Cache diagnostics optimize costs. SEO funnel drives acquisition. Compliance supports sales.

context: When IX Coach executes three strategic pillars
lesson: Three concurrent pillars: (1) GPT-5 Integration - reasoning visibility, model presets, streaming hardening, thinking indicators, customer UX protection; (2) SEO Optimization - keyword landing generation, structured data, bot detection, marketing APIs, FAQ content; (3) Admin Tooling - internal docs, session diagnostics, advisory CI/CD, command bar shortcuts.

context: When new features roll out to customers
lesson: Pattern: admin preview/triage tools built before customer rollout. SEO pages get admin command center. Reasoning gets admin-only toggle. Session diagnostics provide visibility. Internal docs auto-enrich. Ensures quality before customer exposure.

context: When validating new logging implementations across frontend and backend
lesson: Validate logging by: (1) Trigger the event, (2) Hit /api/admin/admin-logs (or UI) to confirm raw payload preserved, (3) If session-scoped, confirm /api/admin/session-diagnostics shows same status. Both surfaces must display the event with collapsible raw payload blocks.

context: When /admin/admin-logs UI is mentioned but not yet implemented
lesson: AGENTS.md references /admin/admin-logs UI that should mirror session diagnostics styling with collapsible raw payload blocks for non-session operational signals. This UI is NOT YET IMPLEMENTED. Backend endpoint GET /api/admin/admin-logs exists. Frontend UI at /admin/admin-logs needs to be built to match session diagnostics patterns.
